body.p:
There are two closed transition transfer procedures using the Color Monitor:
Two-stage permissive signal: external signal must enable the internal signaling process using Color Monitor.
One-stage permissive signal: operator uses Color Monitor to release the SKRU key.

topic.title: Two-Stage Transfer: External Plus Internal Permissive Signals

body.p: Stage 1. An external permissive signal (NO Dry‐contact) enables or disables the internal process that uses the Color Monitor to release the SKRU key.
Stage 2. Internal permissive signal: The PDU checks sources for synchronization. The operator uses the Color Monitor Sync Screen to release the SKRU key.

fig.title: Two-Stage Permissive Signal: External plus Internal

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22039 0000012247_P-164001123 PowerHub 2 Power Distribution Unit 400-1125 kVA Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\41.pdf

topic.title: One-Stage Transfer: Internal Permissive Signal Only

body.p: The PDU is shipped with a jumper installed in TB8 that sets the external signal permanently to “ENABLE.” This reduces the two-stage system to a one-stage system using only the Color Monitor transfer process.

The Color Monitor checks voltage readings on both sources to determine if the two sources are synchronized. When both voltage sources are in synch, the operator can signal the SKRU to release its key using the Color Monitor Sync Screen (). The operator then removes the SKRU key and inserts it into the Kirk Key lock for the inactive power source, allowing that breaker to be closed. Color Monitor Synch Screen
To manually switch the load from one power source to the other using the Color Monitor, use the following procedure: Transfer Procedure Using Internal Permissive Signal with Color Monitor
1.
From the Color Monitor Home screen, go to Alarm screen and clear voltage alarms.
2.
From the Home screen, touch Devices.
3.
Select the PDU device (customer may have renamed the PDU device to a different name).
4.
Touch Readings.
5.
Sync screen appears.
Active power source shows a closed circuit breaker (red).
Inactive power source shows an open circuit breaker (green).
6.
When the Sync screen is displayed, the active source breaker should be closed (red) and the inactive source breaker open (green). If both sources look to be in sync, touch KEY RELEASE to release the SKRU key.
The SKRU will not release the key if
a.
any input voltage alarms are present,
or
b.
the phase difference between sources is greater than 20 degrees (value can be set in PDU Board setup).
7.
The operator should turn the SKRU (solenoid) key and remove it.
8.
The operator should then
a.
insert the SKRU key into the circuit breaker lock for the inactive power source (the open circuit breaker, in this example, Source A);
b.
turn the key; and
c.
close (turn on) the breaker.
NOTE: At this point, both synchronized voltage sources are feeding the PDU and both breakers will show closed (red) on the Sync screen.
9.
Make the previously active source inactive.
a.
Open the circuit breaker for the previously active power source that you are turning off.
b.
Turn the key to lock the breaker.
10.
Move the key from this breaker to the SKRU (solenoid):
a.
Remove the key from the breaker.
b.
Insert it into the lock for the SKRU.
c.
Turn the key.
NOTE: Source A is now the only active source and shows red on the SYNC screen. Source B is locked open (off) and shows green on the SYNC screen.

topic.title: Closed Transition Transfer Using External Permissive Signal Only

body.p: The Manual Dual PDU Option can alternatively be configured to release the SKRU using only the external dry contact connection to TB8. Closing the NO dry contact releases the SKRU key directly. The Color Monitor is not involved in the process. The customer must independently determine that input power sources are synchronized.
Customers implementing the Manual Dual PDU Option using only the external permissive signal should contact the factory at time of order.

table.title: Procedure Using External Permissive Signal Only

entry.p: Determine that both input voltage sources are in sync.
Send the external permissive signal by closing the NO dry contact connected to TB8. (This may be done by a UPS.)
The operator should turn the SKRU (solenoid) key and remove it.

image.href: C:\Users\e9921013\backup\GIT\GIT DITA Maps\PDI\PDI Revised Files Ready for GIT\WR22039 0000012247_P-164001123 PowerHub 2 Power Distribution Unit 400-1125 kVA Installation and Operation Manual\Graphics\46.pdf

entry.p: The operator should then
a.
insert the SKRU key into the circuit breaker lock for the inactive power source (the open circuit breaker, in this example, Source A);
b.
turn the key; and
c.
close (turn on) the breaker.
NOTE:At this point, both synchronized voltage sources are feeding the PDU.
Make the previously active source inactive.
a.
Open the circuit breaker for the previously active power source that you are turning off.
b.
Turn the key to lock the breaker.
Move the key from this breaker to the SKRU (solenoid):
a.
Remove the key from the breaker.
b.
Insert it into the lock for the SKRU.
c.
Turn the key.
NOTE: Source A is now the only active source. Source B is locked open (off).
